habitat_description:
Lasiurus blossevillii typically inhabits riparian hardwood forests of cottonwood, oak, and sycamore (Hargrave, 1944; Hoffmeister and Goodpaster, 1954; Findley et al., 1975; Cook, 1986; Nagorsen and Brigham, 1993; Oliver, 2000; Adams, 2003; Williams et al., 2006). They have also been found in orchards in California’s Central Valley (Constantine, 1959; Lewis et al., 2011).

Occurrences documented in desert habitats may be misleading, as the species is migratory (Shump and Shump, 1982; Constantine, 1999; Oliver, 2000). Captures from water sources within atypical vegetation types may be a misleading indicator of habitat requirements for bats except to indicate that the species needs water (expert review provided for SW ReGAP).
